meanings.definition: A container typically made of wood or metal with a handle, used for carrying bricks or mortar.
meanings.sent1: The worker carried bricks in a hod to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The hod was heavy with bricks as it was lifted onto the scaffold.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat jumped into the hod and pretended to be a brick.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a hod full of bricks when he heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The bright red hod stood out against the gray building, full of fresh mortar.

meanings.definition: To carry or convey in a hod.
meanings.sent1: She hods the bricks carefully to avoid dropping them.
meanings.sent2: They hodded the sand up the ladder to the mason on the rooftop.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to hod each other around the yard for fun.
meanings.sent4: His words hodded a heavy burden of guilt as he confessed his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The old man hodded memories of his youth as he walked through the familiar town.
